titleStmt.title: The Roman histories of Lucius Iulius Florus from the foundation of Rome, till Cæsar Augustus, for aboue DCC. yeares, & from thence to Traian near CC. yeares, divided by Flor[us] into IV. ages. Translated into English.
Epitomae de Tito Livio bellorum omnium annorum DCC libri II. English
titleStmt.author: Florus, Lucius Annaeus.

titleStmt.title: The Roman histories of Lucius Iulius Florus from the foundation of Rome, till Cæsar Augustus, for aboue DCC. yeares, & from thence to Traian near CC. yeares, divided by Flor[us] into IV. ages. Translated into English.
Epitomae de Tito Livio bellorum omnium annorum DCC libri II. English
titleStmt.author: Florus, Lucius Annaeus.
Pass, Simon van de, 1595?-1647, engraver.
Bolton, Edmund, 1575?-1633?

notesStmt.note: On p. 503, "translated into English by E.M.B.", i.e. Edmund Maria Bolton, who signs his pseudonym "Philanactophil" to the dedication.
The title page is engraved and signed "Sim Pass scu.", i.e. Simon van de Pass; the frieze contains the words "The face of L. Florus histories".
Running title reads: L. Florus his histories.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
